Comment: They're spinning the interpretation of the ruling, much like the Trump administration is doing: > In a court filing on Wednesday, Uthmeier’s office argued that the case, brought by immigrants and advocacy groups challenging the new state law, only applies to the named defendants: his office, Florida’s statewide prosecutor and the various state attorneys in Florida. State lawyers said the ruling does not apply to “independent” law enforcement agencies, such as the Highway Patrol, FDLE, county sheriffs’ offices and local police.
